intro: Gastrolychnis longicarpophora, commonly known as the long-fruited gastrolychnis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated蒴果 (capsule) that contains the seeds. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
